questiontext.text:
Exercise

The following data represent the time spent weekly on a variety of activities by the full-time AFAB employees of an engineering company.

Hours spent on:
Travel to and from work\({@decimalplaces(float(a1),1)@}\)
Paid activities in employment\({@decimalplaces(float(a2),1)@}\)
Personal sport and leisure activities\({@decimalplaces(float(a3),1)@}\)
Personal development\({@decimalplaces(float(a4),1)@}\)
Family activities\({@decimalplaces(float(a5),1)@}\)
Sleep\({@decimalplaces(float(a6),1)@}\)
Other\({@decimalplaces(float(a7),1)@}\)

We construct a pie chart showing how the AFAB employees spend their time. Note that the total number of hours spent is 168 (\(7\times 24\)). Compute the sectors angles (in degrees). Enter 1 decimal place (if the answer is a whole number e.g. \(12\) then enter \(12.0\)).

Hours spent on:
Sector Angle (degrees)
Travel to and from work\({@decimalplaces(float(a1),1)@}\)[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]
Paid activities in employment\({@decimalplaces(float(a2),1)@}\)[[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]
Personal sport and leisure activities\({@decimalplaces(float(a3),1)@}\)[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]
Personal development\({@decimalplaces(float(a4),1)@}\)[[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]
Family activities\({@decimalplaces(float(a5),1)@}\)[[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]]
Sleep\({@decimalplaces(float(a6),1)@}\)[[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]] [[feedback:prt6]]
Other\({@decimalplaces(float(a7),1)@}\)[[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]] [[feedback:prt7]]

The pie chart obtained is shown below: proportionally less time spent travelling, more on family activities etc.

generalfeedback.text:
Hours spent on: Sector Angle (degrees)
Travel to and from work \(\dfrac{{@a1@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta1@}\)
Paid activities in employment \(\dfrac{{@a2@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta2@}\)
Personal sport and leisure activities \(\dfrac{{@a3@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta3@}\)
Personal development \(\dfrac{{@a4@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta4@}\)
Family activities \(\dfrac{{@a5@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta5@}\)
Sleep \(\dfrac{{@a6@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta6@}\)
Other \(\dfrac{{@a7@}}{168} \times 360 = {@ta7@}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
